data.title: Trusted Typescript version
data.body:
See #19451 for discussion/motivation.

VS Code should use (and if needed manage) trusted installations of typescript across all workspaces that are used to provide the language features. The information which version of TS should be used can be a workspace settings without exposing users to any potential security issue.

data.title: Cannot debug Jest in VSCode without npm install --legacy-bundling?
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.8.1 (ee428b0eead68bf0fb99ab5fdc4439be227b6281, 2016-12-19T14:49:23.350Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|

This was a fun one to track down. I was not able to get Jest to debug properly to work on my primary laptop and, after several hours of mucking with it, I tried my second laptop. It worked! After comparing differences, I noticed npm was way out of date and ultimately I discovered the hack below. I feel this is an issue the Jest team must address (and I'll be submitting a issue with them) but I was hoping your team might have some insight? At the very least, others having this issue might find this useful.

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Clone my [debug-jest-in-vscode](https://github.com/jbsulli/debug-jest-in-vscode) repo. It's simply the [getting started](http://facebook.github.io/jest/index.html#getting-started) example from Jest but with my VSCode launch config.
2. Use `npm install`, put a breakpoint on `__tests__/sum-test.js:2`, and run.

What I see is, even though I have the `sum-test.js` page open, a new tab labeled `c:\github\debug-jest-in-vscode\__tests__\sum-test.js` is opened (note: I cloned to `C:\github\debug-jest-in-vscode`). If you hover over the tab, the full path it shows is `\1000\c:\github\debug-jest-in-vscode\__tests__\sum-test.js`. Also, my code is wrapped with `({"Object.<anonymous>":function(module,exports,require,__dirname,__filename,global,jest){` + `}});`. The breakpoint is still respected and the program stops in the correct spot; however, neither placing new breakpoints nor editing code in the mystery tab seems to work.

Now, to get it to work:

1. Delete the `node_modules` folder entirely.
2. Use `npm install --legacy-bundling`, put a breakpoint on `__tests__/sum-test.js:2`, and run.

Now everything is peachy and runs and behaves as expected. Any thoughts?

data.title: Why "Error processing launch options at field: environment" ? (Windows)
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.8.1 (ee428b0eead68bf0fb99ab5fdc4439be227b6281, 2016-12-19T14:49:23.350Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|python|donjayamanne|0.5.6|
|java-debug|DSnake|0.0.2|
|ftp-sync|lukasz-wronski|0.3.2|
|Go|lukehoban|0.6.52|
|cpptools|ms-vscode|0.10.0|
|java|redhat|0.0.9|
|RustyCode|saviorisdead|0.19.1|
|cmake|twxs|0.0.15|
|cmake-tools|vector-of-bool|0.9.0|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. I am debugging my program (which needs some environment variable setup before executing correctly)

Here is my launch.json

`{
    "version": "0.2.0",
    "configurations": [

        {
            "name": "C++ Launch (Windows)",
            "type": "cppvsdbg",
            "request": "launch",
            "program": "e:\\code\\prog1\\prog1.exe",
            "args": ["-v"],
            "stopAtEntry": false,
            "cwd": "e:\\code\\prog1\\",
            "environment": [
                {
                "Env1" : "Abc",
                "Env2" : "Cba",
                "Env3": "ccc"
                }   
            ],
            "externalConsole": false,
            "symbolSearchPath": "e:\\code\\prog1\\"
        },
        {
            "name": "C++ Attach (Windows)",
            "type": "cppvsdbg",
            "request": "attach",
            "processId": "${command.pickProcess}"
        }
    ]
}`
2. Always hitting "Error processing launch options at field: environment"?

I am running on Windows.

data.title: Code silently failing on Mac OS Sierra
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: 10.12.2

I simply can't start Code anymore. Yesterday it worked fine, and as far as I can tell, nothing has changed (no updates, neither OS nor Code) since then.

Steps to Reproduce:

```
$ code . --verbose
[main 15:28:23] Sending env to running instance...
[main 15:28:23] Sent env to running instance. Terminating...
$ 
```

Same behaviour when I try to open it from the Applications folder, or without any arguments on the command line.

There are no Code processes running.

```
$ ps -ax | grep code
20412 ??         0:00.04 /System/Library/Frameworks/VideoToolbox.framework/Versions/A/XPCServices/VTDecoderXPCService.xpc/Contents/MacOS/VTDecoderXPCService
23254 ttys005    0:00.00 grep code
```

Nothing of note in the system log either.

data.title: Feature request: require confirm when enter command+Q on macOS
data.body:
Please add option for Mac users to toggle "require confirm when enter command+Q" mode

Then people can void closing vscode by mistake.

data.title: CodeActionsProvider no longer receives the full selection range
Allow to provide colorizers for specific output channels
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8
- OS Version: All

One user of my [Code Runner](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=formulahendry.code-runner) extension reported this issue: https://github.com/formulahendry/vscode-code-runner/issues/59

**Steps to Reproduce**:

1. Install [Output Colorizer ](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=IBM.output-colorizer)
2. Install [Code Runner](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=formulahendry.code-runner)

**Result**: 

IBM's Output Colorizer extension is no longer working.

Both of us using `text/x-code-output` (https://github.com/formulahendry/vscode-code-runner/blob/master/package.json#L197 , https://github.com/IBM-Bluemix/vscode-log-output-colorizer/blob/master/package.json#L4)
Not sure there is a way to avoid the color highlight of one extension overwriting another? Could the color highlight exsit for both extension?

data.title: Fix colorization of nested list.
data.body:
Fixed colorization of nested list with unindented line.
Previously, bullets of nested list with empty line above was not colored.

This change related to #19417 which updated markdown-it version,
and after applied that, two consecutive newlines no longer terminate a list.

data.title: Problem Sending Code to F# Interactive
data.body:
When I press Alt+Enter to send selected F# code to F# Interactive terminal, a "Microsoft Visual C++ Runtime Library" dialog window appears.

The window has a disabled close button and have to terminate it in Task Manager. The window also has a white frame.

I can run Fsi.exe from the command prompt (system path) and these are my settings:

    "FSharp.toolsDirPath": "C:/Program Files (x86)/Microsoft SDKs/F#/4.0/Framework/v4.0",
    "FSharp.fsiFilePath": "C:/Program Files (x86)/Microsoft SDKs/F#/4.0/Framework/v4.0/Fsi.exe",

![s](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16452541/22401403/2c9e8796-e5a8-11e6-9627-22d5ffa3f132.png)

- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: Windows 8.1
- Extension: Ionide 2.21.1

data.title: Added pluralization checks to search's replace-all
data.body: Fixes #17146.

data.title: Remove Gear Icon for "Built-In" Extensions in the Extension Panel
data.body:
**VSCode Version**: Latest Nightly Build _(e68ab660a338a1ccefaa41a2fa010ebbfeeb8dba)_
**OS Version: OS**: Arch Linux _(Kernel: x86_64 Linux 4.9.6-1-ARCH)_

#### Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open extensions panel
2. Find extension marked as "built-in"
3. Click gear icon for that extension

#### Expected Behavior:
Some context menu appears. 

#### Actual Behavior:
Nothing happens. 

![Screen Grab](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2515134/22400608/66d24958-e57f-11e6-830d-987024edf7b2.gif)

If you don't intend for users to be able to disable "built-in" extensions, then the gear icon serves no purpose. Therefor, I propose that it be hidden for "built-in" extensions.


> #### And if you're wondering why my editor's background is funky... It's not actually anything I've done to vscode. I run Arch Linux and have configured my window manager (compiz) to make the vscode window like 20% transparent. The design you're seeing is my desktop wallpaper. I've made no changes to vscode, so this behavior should be present on everybody else's machines too.

data.title: Setting locals to object literals fails
data.body:
_From @adelphes in #19494_ 
- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16, Linux x64
- Node: 6.5.0

On a related note, setting locals to object literals fails - they can only be set to primitives, strings or array literals. What's more annoying is that if you set a local to an array literal, you can't set it back! (because it becomes expandable).

data.title: Multiline logged object preview should be escaped, not cut off

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
See #19550 and #18937

I'd expect console eval and logging cases to look the same.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/323878/22400114/506cc8d2-e561-11e6-859d-2fa675a96bf2.png)

data.title: Fix #19550
data.body:
Related to #17333, probably regressed by https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/commit/ed900e4399a27e18d9f93ae57dc9bc6097f280ee

Need `console.log('a\nb')` to be rendered as multiline, but `console.log({ 'a\nb': 'c\nd' })` to not be. So here, only skip the string height measurement if the variable has children (is an object/array) or has a name (is a prop of an object/array).

This is a hack, I think the newlines in the preview need to be escaped somewhere since they aren't now, and the property values need to go through here after being escaped, which much happen elsewhere.

data.title: [Feature request] Ship to Apple App Store
data.body:
- VSCode Version: any
- OS Version: any

* Installation with the zip file and drag and drop is not the best experience one can provide.
* Visual studio code update on the mac has always been a bit unpredictable in its behavior.  

To address both issue, one good thing would be to publish visual studio code on the app store. I think this would ease installation and update process for users.

data.title: Command in integrated terminal shows up with "typewriter effect"
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: macOS 10.12.3

![](http://i.giphy.com/26gsvx5YU7M4WT9oA.gif)

I'm not sure if the title was well-explained...

But as you can see in the gif (sorry for the low fps), when I started debugging my program, the commands lunched by debugger showed up with **"typewriter effect"**, which was really annoying when a long command was executed.

After some investigation, I found it was caused by zsh's plugin [zsh-autosuggestions](https://github.com/zsh-users/zsh-autosuggestions). When I commented this plugin out from `.zshrc`, the command just showed up on the terminal immediately.

However, this issue didn't occurred when pasting command on iTerm2.

data.title: [WelcomeUX] Copy `code-icon.svg` to near where it's used
data.body:
- https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/parts/walkThrough/electron-browser/walkThroughPart.css#L144
- https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/parts/welcomePage/electron-browser/welcomePage.css#L263

The icon should be copied close to the CSS where it is being used, just like every icon and image we have.

The only reason this is working now is that @alexandrudima enabled SVG inlining *when* the SVG is small enough and the loader actually is able to escape the `vs` namespace during bundling.

data.title: api-doc-json failing after commit
data.body:
After commit https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/commit/a6435b1cbd1417b0d334ea9018f5371df198898f the vscode-docs gulp task api-doc-json is failing with exception:

[22:16:40] 'api-doc-json' errored after 4.78 s
[22:16:40] TypeError: Cannot read property 'toObject' of undefined
    at C:\Users\gregvanl\vscode-docs\node_modules\typedoc\dist\lib\models\types\reference.js:36:82
    at Array.map (native)
    at ReferenceType.toObject (C:\Users\gregvanl\vscode-docs\node_modules\typedoc\dist\lib\models\types\reference.js:36:55)
    at DeclarationReflection.toObject (C:\Users\gregvanl\vscode-docs\node_modules\typedoc\dist\lib\models\reflections\declaration.js:54:37)
    at C:\Users\gregvanl\vscode-docs\node_modules\typedoc\dist\lib\models\reflections\abstract.js:268:37
    at C:\Users\gregvanl\vscode-docs\node_modules\typedoc\dist\lib\models\reflections\container.js:26:17
    at Array.forEach (native)
    at DeclarationReflection.ContainerReflection.traverse (C:\Users\gregvanl\vscode-docs\node_modules\typedoc\dist\lib\models\reflections\container.js:25:27)
    at DeclarationReflection.traverse (C:\Users\gregvanl\vscode-docs\node_modules\typedoc\dist\lib\models\reflections\declaration.js:49:35)
    at DeclarationReflection.Reflection.toObject (C:\Users\gregvanl\vscode-docs\node_modules\typedoc\dist\lib\models\reflections\abstract.js:261:14)

Should 		 
onDidChangeCodeLenses?: Event<this>;
be 
onDidChangeCodeLenses?: Event<CodeLens>;

data.title: editor.rulers should not be zero indexed
data.body:
`editor.rulers` seems to be zero index. If I set the value to 80, I expect it to be displayed at column 80, but it is displayed at column 81. To display at column 80, I have to set it to 79.

- VSCode Version: 1.81
- OS Version: Windows 7 SP1

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Set the user setting: `"editor.rulers": [80]`
2. Rulers are displayed starting at column 81, not 80

![column 81](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1139781/22394680/a979c15e-e50d-11e6-88fd-fdaf16a45090.png)

data.title: "Select environment" popup shows twice
data.body:
- Open workspace with no launch.json
- Open file that isn't JS
- Press F5
- See "Select environment" popup
- Press Esc
- See the popup again
- Press Esc again
- Now it's gone
